content: Beverly took in the otherwise homeless Howard, giving him a place to stay, and the two became close friends. Their life together was far from conventional, they struggled to make ends meet, living “hand-to-beak,” with Beverly posing as a model for life-drawing classes to pay the bills.They often faced extraordinary obstacles together, such as Turnip-Man, Beverly’s space turnip possessed roommate, Winky-Man, their narcoleptic vigilante upstairs-neighbor, or Le Beaver the Canadian Super-Patriot. But in spite of it all their relationship blossomed and they managed to fall in love.
significantissues: Marriage to Dr. Bong (Howard the Duck #18 1977)
